creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mrs Jackson Burke
description: colorful, continuous landscapes with rounded, multi-leveled rock formations, fishing boats, small huts and temple buildings, trees, and figures
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Mark, and Seals

ULQ: [ 沈沈能切切芽（牙？）子亦源源左右兩（or 苟）先覚要似（琴？）苑原 ] (Soft, soft - or he can play clean and crisp: / Master Ya indeed produces torrents of sound! / Should those on both sides first become enlightened / They\'ll think they\'re at the source of the Garden of Ch\'in Music!) (SA)
markings: on satin label when rolled, in pen: [No. 1921 / Tesseki] ULQ, square intaglio; ULQ, square relief: [  鉄石 ]
signed: ULC: [ 戊子卯月写並題鉄石居士？]
title: Landscapes
